info.title: Mirth Connect API
info.description:
Node.js Mirth Connect REST API — compatible with Mirth Connect Administrator.

This API provides full channel management, message processing, user authentication, and monitoring capabilities. All endpoints (except health checks and login) require authentication.

tags.name: Health
tags.description: Readiness, liveness, and startup probes (no auth required)

tags.name: Channel Status
tags.description: Channel lifecycle operations (start, stop, pause, resume)

tags.name: Messages
tags.description: Message search, retrieval, processing, and attachments

sessionCookie.name: JSESSIONID
sessionCookie.description: Session cookie set after login via POST /api/users/_login

sessionHeader.name: X-Session-ID
sessionHeader.description: Alternative session ID passed as header

transportName.description: Transport type (e.g., HTTP Listener, Channel Writer, TCP Sender)

status.description: R=RECEIVED, F=FILTERED, T=TRANSFORMED, S=SENT, Q=QUEUED, E=ERROR, P=PENDING

get.description: Returns 200 when ready to accept traffic, 503 during shutdown. No auth required.
Always returns 200. Used by orchestrators to detect crashed processes.
Returns 200 after channels are deployed. Used by orchestrators for slow-start.

post.description: Authenticate with username and password. Returns session cookie.

200.description: Login result (check status field for SUCCESS/FAIL)

post.description: Destroy current session and clear session cookie.

get.summary: Get user by ID or username

200.description: Empty array if valid, or array of requirement violations

get.summary: Check if user is logged in

200.description: Array of requirement violations (empty if valid)

get.description: Get all channels or filter by IDs.

post.description: POST alternative for large ID sets.

200.description: Map of channel UUIDs to channel names

schema.description: Map of channelId → { revision } for cached channels

200.description: Map of metaDataId to connector name

schema.description: Return errors instead of 204 on failure

parameters.description: Return errors instead of 204 on failure
parameters.name: returnErrors

post.description: Deploy channels by ID list. Accepts JSON array or XML set format.

200.description: Dashboard channel info with remaining channel IDs

get.description: Search messages with filter criteria. Query parameters map to MessageFilter fields.

schema.description: Filter by status (R, F, T, S, Q, E, P)

parameters.description: Filter by status (R, F, T, S, Q, E, P)
parameters.name: statuses

post.description: Submit a raw message for processing by the channel.
